trans-unit.source: Used by the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMap"></xref> class to track the set of <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> objects that are available to the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMap"></xref> during site map initialization.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> class is a strongly typed <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> collection of <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> objects.

In addition to the two add methods, <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%28System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase%29> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%28System.Web.SiteMapProvider%29>, the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> class supports the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> method to add an array of type <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider>.

The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> is used by the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> class to track the set of <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> objects that are available to the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> during site map initialization.
However, the presence of a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> in the provider collection does not necessarily mean it is used by a <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> object, only that it is available for use.
When a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> is stored in the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection>, the <xref:System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase.Name%2A> property is used as the key.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.%23ctor%2A> default constructor initializes any fields to their default values
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> to the provider collection using the <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase.Name"></xref> property as the key.
The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> object that is returned by the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> property is read-only.

For this reason, you cannot use the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods to add additional providers programmatically at run time.

Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods are used only in scenarios where you manually create site map provider objects and manage them with an instance of the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> class.

The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%28System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase%29> method checks the type of the specified provider, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%28System.Web.SiteMapProvider%29> method to add it to the collection.

Because the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> class is static, any <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> contained in its <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> collection remains for the lifetime of the Web application.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> to add.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase.Name"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> is `null`.
provider is not an instance of the class.
\- or -
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> with the same name already exists in the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> object to the provider collection using the <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase.Name"></xref> property as the key.
The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> object that is returned by the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> property is read-only.

For this reason, you cannot use the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods to programmatically add additional providers to the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> at run time.

Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods are used only in scenarios where you manually create site map provider objects and manage them with an instance of the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> method when you want to add a single <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> to the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection>.

Because the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> class is static, any <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> contained in its <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> collection remains for the lifetime of the Web application.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> to add.
provider is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref> is read-only.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> with the same name already exists in the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref>.

Adds an array of <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> objects into the provider collection using the <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase.Name"></xref> properties as keys.
The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> that is returned by the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> property is read-only.

For this reason, you cannot use the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods to add additional providers programmatically at run time.

Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection.AddArray%2A> methods are only used in scenarios where you manually create site map provider objects and manage them with an instance of the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> class.

Because the <xref:System.Web.SiteMap> class is static, any <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProvider> contained in its <xref:System.Web.SiteMap.Providers%2A> collection remains for the lifetime of the Web application.
The array of <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> objects to add.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> with the same name already exists in the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref>.
providerArray is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> object with a specific name from the provider collection.
You can use the indexer to iterate over the contents of a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection> object.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> to find.
A <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProvider"></xref> that represents a <xref href="System.Web.SiteMapProviderCollection"></xref> element.
